terms.name: Architecture as Code
terms.summary: Codifies architectural intent, constraints, and automation as executable artefacts.

related.reason: Knowledge graph inventories codified architecture components and their associations.
Policies are executed against Architecture as Code models to guarantee guardrails.
ADRs provide context for Architecture as Code changes and integrations.

terms.name: Infrastructure as Code
terms.summary: Automates provisioning of infrastructure resources through declarative definitions.

related.reason: Infrastructure templates implement the platform layer of Architecture as Code models.
Compliance automation assesses IaC changes against mandated controls.
GitOps reconciles IaC declarations with live environments.

terms.name: Architecture Decision Record
terms.summary: Concise record of architectural choices including context, decision, and consequences.

related.reason: ADRs explain why Architecture as Code artefacts exist and how they should evolve.
Knowledge graph entries reference ADRs to make decisions discoverable.
Compliance narratives cite ADRs to demonstrate design intent and approvals.

terms.name: Knowledge Graph
terms.summary: Connected dataset that maps architectural artefacts, policies, and ownership.

related.reason: Knowledge graphs catalogue the structural elements described by Architecture as Code.
Compliance automation queries the graph to locate obligated components and metadata.
Team topology records leverage graph links to understand responsibilities.

terms.name: Compliance Automation
terms.summary: Automated controls that continuously validate architectural and operational adherence.

related.reason: Policies defined as code are executed within compliance automation pipelines.
Compliance jobs analyse IaC artefacts before promotion.
Control execution is prioritised using ownership and impact data from the knowledge graph.

terms.name: Policy as Code
terms.summary: Machine-readable rules that encode organisational guardrails and compliance obligations.

related.reason: Policies constrain Architecture as Code deployments to safe, approved patterns.
Compliance automation runs policy checks as part of every change.
Policy updates are captured in ADRs to preserve organisational memory.
